intro: Thlaspi albanicum, commonly known as the Albanian cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lobed and somewhat succulent. Thlaspi albanicum is also known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
